subject: College Athletics
Football
lead_paragraph: Andre Caldwell scored on a 2-yard end around on the final play of the Senior Bowl on Saturday to cap a 14-play, 86-yard drive and lift the South over the North, 17-16.Caldwell, a receiver at Florida, took the handoff from Tennessee’s Erik Ainge and plunged across the goal line. Ainge, who was invited to the all-star game in Mobile, Ala., after Louisville’s Brian Brohm bowed out, completed 13 of 21 passes for 159 yards, all in the second half.Michigan’s Chad Henne accounted for both North touchdowns, throwing a 36-yard pass to Lavelle Hawkins of California in the first half and a 4-yarder to Missouri tight end Martin Rucker with 14 minutes 32 seconds left in the game.
